docs.title: Competitive Online Algorithms
docs.text:
Welcome to the documentation. This site covers the offline problem generation pipeline and the online algorithms (CZL-ORB, BAT-ORB, ITM-ORB) for motion planning.

Use the navigation to browse topics.

docs.title: Data Artifacts
docs.text:
All offline artifacts live under results/data/offline problems/.

  • graphs with risks/: *_edge_values.csv
  • problem details/: *_decision_timeline.csv, *_candidates.csv
  • solution details/: *_solution_edges.csv, *_solution_nodes.csv
  • Optimal candidates (offline): *_opt_solution.csv
  • Online outputs: results/data/online solutions/graph-based and results/data/online solutions/candidates

docs.title: BAT-ORB
docs.text: BAT-ORB is a threshold online algorithm for candidates-based problems.

docs.title: Threshold
docs.text:
• Compute global $\delta_{\min}$ (minimum positive risk) via bat_threshold.
  • Per epoch, $\Psi_{bat}(t) = (\Delta_0 / \Delta_t) \ln(1 + \Delta_0 / \delta_{\min})$.

docs.title: Policy
docs.text:
• Feasible set: candidates with $R(\tau) \le \Delta_t$ and $\rho(\tau) \ge \Psi_{bat}(t)$.
  • Pick feasible candidate with highest $\rho$; if none, return None.
  • Deduct chosen risk from remaining budget.

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Writes selected rows to *_online_BAT-ORB.csv under results/data/online solutions/candidates.

docs.title: CZL-ORB
docs.text: CZL-ORB is a threshold online algorithm for candidates-based problems.

docs.title: Thresholds
docs.text:
• Compute global $\rho_{\min}, \rho_{\max}$ across all candidates via czl_thresholds.
  • Per epoch, threshold $\Psi_{czl}(t) = ((\rho_{max} e)/\rho_{min})^z (\rho_{min}/e)$ with $z = 1 - \Delta_t/\Delta_0$.

docs.title: Policy
docs.text:
• Feasible set: candidates with $R(\tau) \le \Delta_t$ and $\rho(\tau) \ge \Psi_{czl}(t)$.
  • Pick feasible candidate with highest $\rho$; if none, return None.
  • Deduct chosen risk from remaining budget.

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Writes selected rows to *_online_CZL-ORB.csv under results/data/online solutions/candidates.

docs.title: Development Notes
docs.text:
• Offline generation entrypoint: src/motion_planning/offline_problems/Main.py.
  • Online algorithms: src/motion_planning/online_algorithms/.
  • Run mkdocs serve to preview docs locally; mkdocs build to generate static site.

docs.title: ITM-ORB
docs.text: ITM-ORB is a graph-based online solver using a MILP.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text:
• Edge metrics: *_edge_values.csv
  • Decision timeline: *_decision_timeline.csv
  • Optional graph pickle, total budget $\Delta_0$, and threshold $\psi$.

docs.title: MILP (per epoch)
docs.text: Variables: binary $x_{ij}^ u$, continuous $\delta_t \in [0, \Delta_t]$. Constraints: - Flow conservation from $v_s$ to $v_g$. - Risk: $\sum x\,r \le \delta_t$. - Utility: $\sum x\,u \ge \psi\,\delta_t$ (if $\psi>0$). - One speed per edge: $\sum_ u x_{ij}^ u \le 1$. Objective: maximize $\sum x\,u$.

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Per-epoch selections (edges with speeds, $\delta_t$, objective, remaining budget). Extend to full path constraints as needed.

docs.title: Artifacts
docs.text:
• Edge metrics: *_edge_values.csv
  • Decision timelines: *_decision_timeline.csv
  • Candidates: *_candidates.csv
  • Offline optimal: *_solution_edges.csv (graph-based), *_opt_solution.csv (candidates-based)

docs.title: Generation
docs.text: Offline problems are generated via src/motion_planning/offline_problems/Main.py, which builds risks, candidates, and persists CSV artifacts under results/data/offline problems/.

docs.title: Online Algorithms Overview
docs.text:
The online layer consumes offline artifacts and produces online decisions under a risk budget.

  • Candidates-based: CZL-ORB, BAT-ORB operate on *_candidates.csv and write *_online_<ALG>.csv to results/data/online solutions/candidates.
  • Graph-based: ITM-ORB operates on *_edge_values.csv + *_decision_timeline.csv and produces per-epoch selections (extendable to full paths).

Shared helpers live in src/motion_planning/online_algorithms/: - load_problem_to_solve.py for loaders/writers. - thresholds.py for global threshold parameters.

docs.title: CZL-ORB (candidates)
docs.text:
• Inputs: a *_candidates.csv, total budget Δ0, and global rho_min/rho_max computed over the full set of candidates (use czl_thresholds([...])).
  • Call: run_czl_orb(candidates_csv, capacity_override=Δ0, rho_min=..., rho_max=..., output_root=results/data/online solutions/candidates).
  • Avoid relying on auto rho bounds from a single file; precompute them globally.

docs.title: BAT-ORB (candidates)
docs.text:
• Inputs: a *_candidates.csv, total budget Δ0, and global δ_min (min positive risk) computed over the full set of candidates (use bat_threshold([...])).
  • Call: run_bat_orb(candidates_csv, capacity_override=Δ0, delta_min=..., output_root=results/data/online solutions/candidates).
  • Avoid running without delta_min; compute it once from all candidates.

docs.title: ITM-ORB (graph)
docs.text:
• Inputs: *_edge_values.csv, *_decision_timeline.csv, total budget Δ0, candidate files in the sibling problem details directory (to derive CZL thresholds), optional graph pickle, and Gurobi params (e.g., GUROBI_OPTIONS).
  • Call: run_itm_online(edge_values_csv, decision_timeline_csv, capacity=Δ0, psi_t=None, gurobi_params=GUROBI_OPTIONS, graph_pickle_path=..., output_root=results/data/online solutions/graph-based).
  • The code computes per-epoch psi via CZL (czl_psi) using rho_min/rho_max from the candidates; if candidates are missing, ITM will raise.
  • Avoid omitting capacity (to skip filename parsing) and ensure candidates exist alongside the graph artifacts.
